►はばかりながらこう見えても, 私は柔道 5 段空手 3 段だ.　I may not look it, but I have to tell you I am (actually) a fifth dan in judo and a third dan in karate.

・恥を知れ!　For shame! ｜ Shame on you! ｜ What a disgrace! ｜ Shame! ｜ You ought to be ashamed.
・恥を知れと叫ぶ　cry shame 《at [on]…》
・恥をかく　disgrace oneself; humiliate oneself; be put to shame; bring disgrace upon oneself; be clothed with shame
・恥をかかせる　shame sb; put sb to shame; humiliate; bring sb into contempt; insult; put sb out of countenance
・恥をさらす　make ┏an ass [a beast, a fool] of oneself; make ┏a show [an exhibition] of oneself; bring shame on oneself; disgrace oneself in public
・内輪の恥を外に出さない[さらけ出す]　wash one's dirty linen ┏at home [in public]
・内輪の恥を世間にさらすな.　Don't wash your dirty ┏clothes [linen] in public.
・恥を忍ぶ　suppress the feeling of shame; abide one's shame; 〔侮辱を〕 pocket [brook] an insult; *《口》 eat crow
・恥を忍んで…する　bear shame to do; stoop to do; swallow one's pride to do
・恥をそそぐ[すすぐ]　wipe away a ┏reproach [disgrace]; vindicate one's honor; clear one's name
・恥を恥とも思わない　be ┏lost [dead] to all sense of shame
・恥を申せば　to confess the shameful truth
・恥を申しあげねばなりませんが, 実は….　I must confess to my shame that…. ｜ I am ashamed to admit it, but….
►あの子は一家の恥だ.　That boy is a ┏disgrace [discredit] to our family.
・それは男の恥だ.　A man must be ashamed of it.
・旅の恥はかき捨て.　⇒たび２.
・聞くは一時の恥, 聞かぬは末代の恥.　⇒きく５ 4.
◧恥さらし　⇒はじさらし.
恥知らず　⇒はじしらず.

hold; grasp; clasp; grip.

はじかみ【薑】 [ローマ字](hajikami)
1 〔しょうが〕 a ginger (plant); (香辛料) ginger.

はじけまめ【はじけ豆】 [ローマ字](hajikemame)
pop [popped] beans; parched peas.

はじける [ローマ字](hajikeru)
1 〔破裂する〕 burst [crack] open; (さやなどが) split open; (たがなどが) spring off.
►栗の実は焼くとはじけるから危ないよ.　Chestnuts will burst open when roasted, so be careful!
・その時私の中で何かがはじけ世界観が変わった.　It felt like something ┏snapped [clicked] inside me then, and my view of the world changed.
2 〔若さなどがあふれ出る〕 be bursting 《with…》; 〔抑えられていたものが一気に表に出る〕 burst out 《into the open》.

・はじけるような笑顔　a gushing smile
・はじけるような若さ　youth ready to burst at the seams

►高校生になったら急にはじけちゃって, 化粧もするし, 彼女はずいぶん変わったよ.　Something suddenly broke loose inside of her when she entered high school. She started wearing makeup, and she really changed.

はじけとぶ【はじけ飛ぶ】 [ローマ字](hajiketobu)
fly off.

・弦をはじく　pluck [touch] the strings

はじまらない【始まらない】 [ローマ字](hajimaranai)
►今となってそんなこと言ったって始まらない.　There's no point saying so now.
・そんな人と議論しても始まらない.　There is no sense arguing with such a person.
・泣いたって始まらない.　Crying won't get you anywhere.

はじまり【始まり】 [ローマ字](hajimari)
〔始まること〕 the beginning; the start; the opening; 〔発端・起源〕 the origin.
►宇宙の始まり　the origin of the universe
・小説の始まり　the opening of a novel
・転落の始まり　the beginning of one's downfall
・流体中での対流[不安定]の始まり　【物】 the onset of ┏convection [instability] in a fluid.
►けんかの始まりはちょっとした意見の食い違いからだった.　The argument arose out of a minor difference of opinion.
・ことの始まりは 10 年前, ヨーロッパに旅行したときのことです.　It all started ten years ago, when I took a trip to Europe.

はじまる【始まる】 [ローマ字](hajimaru)
1 〔その時期になる〕 begin; start; open.
►演奏が始まる　a performance begins
・スキーのシーズンが始まる　ski season ┏starts [opens].
►いよいよ選挙戦がはじまった.　At last the campaign has kicked off.
・もうすぐ新学期が始まる.　The new term will be starting soon.
・改革はまだ始まったばかりだ.　The reform has only just gotten underway.
・彼らの交際はそうして始まった.　That's how they first started going out together.
・1 時に会議が始まった.　The conference began at one o'clock.
・始球式で試合が始まった.　The game opened with a ceremonial first pitch.
・夏の高校野球が甲子園で始まった.　The summer high school baseball tournament got underway at Kōshien.
・隣家の改築が始まった.　Renovation of the house next door has started.
・劇場に着いた時には芝居は始まっていた.　The play was underway when I got to the theater.
・もうあのテレビ番組が始まっている.　The show's on already.
・そら, また(いつもの癖が)始まった.　There you go again!
・うちの会社は毎朝 9 時に始まる.　Work begins at 9 a.m. at our company.
・夏休みは 8 月 1 日に始まる　Summer vacation starts August 1st.
・博覧会は来月 3 日から始まる.　The exposition ┏opens [will be opened] on the 3rd of next month.
・始まる前から不満を言うなよ.　Don't complain before things even get started.
・この小説は主人公の独白で始まる.　This book opens with a monologue by the main character.
・この曲はピアニッシモで始まる.　This piece starts off pianissimo.
・チーズ作りは牛乳を凝固させるところから始まる.　Curdling milk is the first step in making cheese.
・インフルエンザの流行が始まった.　The influenza epidemic has arrived.
・われわれの苦しみはその時始まった.　That was when our troubles began.
2 〔生じる〕 arise; be born; get under way; get off the ground.
►師弟関係が始まる　a teacher-student relationship develops.
►悲劇は些細なことから始まる.　Tragedy originates in the most trivial matter.
・彼らの恋愛はそれをきっかけに始まった.　That was how their romance was born.
・2 人のいさかいは小さな誤解から始まった.　The quarrel between them grew from a minor misunderstanding.
・あそこで何が始まったんだろう. けんかか?　What's up there? A fight?
・彼らの活動から平和運動が始まった.　Their activities gave rise to a broader peace movement.
・この計画はあの人の一言で始まったんだ.　His remark set the plan in motion.
・何かが始まりそうな気配だ.　There is something in the wind. ｜ Something is going to happen, I can feel it coming.
3 〔起源がある〕 originate 《in…》; have 《its》 ┏origin [rise] 《in…》; arise 《from…》.
►この祭は奈良時代に始まったという.　This festival is said to date from the Nara period.
・これは近代に始まったものだ.　This is of modern origin.
・今に始まったことではない.　That is an old story.

はじめ１【始め・初め】 [ローマ字](hajime)
1 【始め】 〔始めること〕 start; beginning; commencement; inception.
►始めの言葉　〔開会の辞〕 opening remarks.
2 【初め】 〔一続きのものの最初〕 the start; the outset; 〔初期〕 the beginning; early 《in…》.
►初めから終わりまで　from (the) beginning to (the) end; from ┏start [first] to ┏finish [last]; from A to ┏Z [izzard]
・書物を初めから終わりまで読む　read a book from cover to cover
・この花は夏の初めから咲き始めます.　This flower starts to bloom at the outset of summer.
・彼は月の初めからずっと休んでいる.　He's been out since the beginning of the month.
►章の初めに　at the beginning of the chapter
・今月の初めに　at the beginning of this month
・5 月の初めに　early in May
・去年の初めに　in the early months of last year
・20 世紀の初めに　in the early ┏part [years] of the 20th century; early in the 20th century
・ダ・カーポは初めに戻るという印だ.　The da capo is a symbol indicating a return to the start of the piece.
・その本の初めにブレークの詩がある.　The book opens with a poem of Blake's.
►その歌の(歌詞の)初めは何だっけ.　How's that song start?
3 【始め・初め】 〔物事を始めたばかりのころ〕 the beginning; the opening; the start; the outset; the threshold; 〔最初〕 (the) first.
►始めがうまく行く　make a successful beginning; make a good start
・始めが大事, 始めよければ終わり[すべて]よし.　A good beginning makes a good ending. 【諺】 ｜ Well begun is half done. 【諺】
►始めから　from the ┏beginning [start, first]; from [at] scratch
・始めから終わりまで　from the ┏beginning [start] until the ┏end [finish]
・始めからやり直す　do all over again; begin afresh; make a new start
・(途中からではなく)始めからやりなさい.　Begin at the beginning.
・そのことは私は始めから知っていた.　I knew it all along.
・始めから完璧には行かないものさ.　You can hardly expect to be perfect from the outset.
・計画は始めからうまく行かないのに決まっていた.　The plan was foredoomed to failure.
・あなたは始めから東京にお住まいですか.　Have you always lived in Tokyo?
►始めで失敗する　begin at the wrong end; make a ┏false [wrong] start.
►始めに　in the beginning; at the ┏beginning [start]; at the (very) outset; first(ly); early on
・始めに　〔本の前書き〕 Introduction
・始めにお断り申し上げます.　Let me say at the outset that….
・始めに言葉ありき.　【聖】 In the beginning was the Word.
►始めの　〔最初の〕 first; initial; inceptive; incipient; (初期の) early; (前者の) the former; 〔もとの〕 original; primary
・始めの日　the first day
・始めの一歩　the first step
・その演説の始めの方を私は聞き逃してしまった.　I missed the opening of the speech.
・始めの話では 1 週間もあればできるということだったのに.　At first you told me that you could do it in a week―what happened?.
►始めは　at first; at the ┏start [outset]; 〔元は〕 originally; primarily
・始めは失敗した.　I failed (in it) at first.
・彼は始めは新聞記者だった.　He began his life as a newsman.
・始めは皆そうだった.　We all started that way.
・始めは会員がたった 5 人だった.　We had only five members to start with.
・私は始めは教師になるつもりはなかった.　Teaching was not my original intention.
・その会社は始めは小さなものだった.　The company began in a small way.
・始めは…で, 終わりは…　at first…and at last…
・始めは猫なで声で頼んでいたが終わりにはおどしにかかった.　He began with soft entreaties and ended with threats.
・始めは処女のごとく終わりは脱兎(だっと)のごとし.　He started at the slow pace of a bashful maiden but finished with the speed of a hunted hare.
・始めちょろちょろ中ぱっぱ赤子泣くとも蓋取るな.　A low flame at the start, a high flame in the middle, and don't take the lid off the pot even if the baby cries.
・何事にも始めはある.　You have to start somewhere.
4 【始め】 〔起源〕 the origin; the genesis.
►国の始め　the origins of a nation.
5 【初め】 〔順序の最初〕 the first.
►初めが前菜で, 次がスープ.　The first course is an hors d'oeuvre, followed by soup.
►初めに, 市議会議長の本田様, よろしくお願いします.　〔来賓祝辞〕 First let us hear from Ms. Honda, the chair of the city council.
►初めの組から 5 分遅れでスタートします.　We start 5 minutes after the first group.
・彼の初めの奥さんは中国人で次の奥さんは韓国人だった.　His first wife was Chinese and his next Korean.

はじめ２ [ローマ字](hajime)
including…; …and; as well as…; (言うまでもなく) not to speak of….
►首相はじめ各閣僚　the Cabinet Members, ┏including the Prime Minister [from the Prime Minister down]
・私はじめだれも…　everyone, myself included, ….
►課長をはじめとしてこの課はだれもたばこを吸わない.　No one in this section smokes, from the manager on down.
・教室をはじめ, 体育館から中庭まで全部探した.　We looked everywhere, from the classrooms to the gym and on to the playground.
・その店では学用品をはじめ, 駄菓子や家庭雑貨などいろんな物を売っていた.　That store used to sell any number of things: school supplies, as well as candy and sundries.
・すしをはじめ, 和食はなんでも好きです.　I love Japanese food, starting with sushi.
・浜田氏はじめ5 人が委員に選ばれた.　Mr. Hamada and four others were elected on the committee.

はじめまして【初めまして】 [ローマ字](hajimemashite)
How do you do? ｜ Nice [Pleased, Glad] to meet you. ｜ I'm glad to make your acquaintance.

はじめね【始め値】 [ローマ字](hajimene)
〔株や外国為替で〕 an opening ┏price [quotation].

はじめる【始める】 [ローマ字](hajimeru)
1 〔動作を開始する〕 begin; start; make a start; get started; set about…; take ┏to [up] sth; commence; initiate; 〔新たに行動を起こす〕 begin [start] again [afresh, anew].
►会議を始める　open a meeting
・講演を始める　begin a lecture
・旅行の準備を始める　start getting ready for a trip
・毎朝 8 時に掃除を始める　start cleaning every morning at eight
・新製品の販売を始める　launch marketing of a new product
・学生生活を始める　begin one's life as a student; dive into student life
・大会は会長の挨拶(あいさつ)で始める　the convention opens with a speech by the chair.
►試合は何時に始めようか.　When should we start the game?
・さあ(食事などを)始めよう.　Let's eat. ｜ Let's get started.
・来週の授業は 23 ページから始める.　Next week's lesson begins on page 23.
・私がいなくても食事を始めてください.　Please go ahead and eat even if I haven't arrived yet.
・私は 60 歳で水泳を始めた.　I took up swimming at age 60.
・ピアノの練習はバイエルから始めた.　I started off piano practice with Beyer.

はかる１【量る・計る・測る】 [ローマ字](hakaru)
1 〔容量・寸法を〕 measure; gauge; take ┏measure [the dimensions] of…; 〔目方を〕 weigh; 〔水深を〕 fathom; sound; plumb; 〔測量する〕 survey.
►山の高さを測る　measure [gauge] the height of a mountain
・分量を量る　calculate [compute, estimate] the ┏number [quantity]
・熱[体温]を測る　measure the ┏heat [body temperature]
・血圧を測る　measure blood pressure
・溶液の濃度を測る　measure the density of a solution
・時間を測る　measure [calculate] the time
・面積を測る　compute the area
・道具や機械で測る　measure with tools or equipment
・手や目で測る　compute by hand and eye.
►この紙の長さと幅を測ってみてください.　Please measure the length and width of this piece of paper. ｜ Figure out how long and wide this piece of paper is, will you?
・その家の住みやすさというものは広さや間取りだけでは測れない.　It's not possible to guage the comfortability of the house by the width or room arrangements.
2 〔心中などを推量する〕 fathom; sound; plumb; 〔加減を見る〕 calculate. [⇒はかりがたい]
►相手の気持ちを量る　infer how sb feels
・おのれを以て人を量る　measure others by one's own ┏yardstick [standard(s)]
・ころあいを計る　time one's move
・時期を計る　pick one's timing.
►あの人の真意は量りかねる.　I can hardly fathom his ┏real intentions [true motives].
・今のところ当局はその効果を量りかねている.　At present the authorities are not able to evaluate the effect(s).

2 〔明確に・確定的に〕 exactly; certainly; for certain; definitely; loudly and clearly; loud and clear; in no uncertain terms; in black and white; 《文》 without equivocation.
〜する be clear; be certain; be exact; be definite.

・はっきりした区別　a ┏sharp [clear, clear-cut] distinction; a clear difference

・輪郭がはっきりしない　The outlines 《of her face》 are blurred. ｜ You can't see the lines 《of her face》 clearly.
・彼は何時に出発するかはっきりしたことは言わなかった.　He did not tell me the exact time of his departure.

・彼はどうもはっきりしない男だ.　He does not know his own mind.
・その原因ははっきりしない.　The cause isn't clear.

・予定がはっきりし次第お伝えします.　I'll let you know as soon as ┏my plans are clear [I know what my schedule is].
・私の腰痛はどうもはっきりしません.　My backache doesn't seem to be getting any better.
・「うーん, どうしようかなあ」「おい, はっきりしろよ」　"Mmm; what shall I do?"―"Come on! Make up your mind!"
►はっきり返事をする　answer definitely; give a definite answer; answer loud and clear

・はっきりとは存じません.　I don't know for ┏certain [sure].
・今ははっきりとは決められない.　I cannot decide (definitely) for the moment.

〜する make clear; be frank; be outspoken.
►はっきりした人　an outspoken person; a plain-spoken person
・「日曜は家族のために使いたいので休日出勤はお断りします」「はっきりしてるね, 今時の若い者は」　"Sundays are for the family, and I'm not coming into work then."―"Wow! You young people ┏(don't hesitate to) say what you think, do you [come straight out with it, don't you]!"

►賛成の人は拍手してください.　All those in favor please clap your hands.
・彼の提案にみんなが拍手した.　Everyone applauded his proposal.
・聴衆はその名演奏に立ち上がって拍手した.　The audience stood and applauded his excellent performance.
・私はその光景に心の中で拍手した.　In my heart I applauded the spectacle.
►拍手がやむ[まばらになる]　applause ┏dies down [thins out]
・彼女が姿をあらわすと割れるような拍手が起こった.　A storm of applause arose at her appearance. ｜ A flurry of clapping greeted her appearance.
・幕が下りても拍手が鳴りやまなかった.　The applause showed no signs of abating even after the curtain went down.
►嵐のような[割れるような]拍手のうちに　amidst ┏a thunderous clapping of hands [a storm of applause]
・あまり拍手の音も聞こえなかった.　There wasn't much clapping heard.
►拍手をもって迎える　welcome sb with applause
・お客様に盛大な拍手をお願いします.　Let's give our guest ┏a big hand [a round of applause].
・お客様から拍手をもらえる芸人になりたい.　I want to become the kind of entertainer who can be applauded by the audience.
・あたたかい拍手をありがとう.　Thank you for your warm applause.
・手で股(もも)を二回たたき, 次に拍手を二つ, これを歌に合わせて繰り返します.　Slap your thighs twice, then clap twice, and repeat in time with the song.
►会場は鳴りやまぬ拍手と歓声に包まれた.　The site was surrounded with unceasing applause and cheers.
・拍手はやがて手拍子に変わった.　The applause changed to a rhythmic clapping.

はくしゅかっさい【拍手喝采】 [ローマ字](hakushukassai)

►拍手喝采して喜ぶ　rejoice with a clapping of hands.
►その劇は拍手喝采のうちに閉幕となった.　The play ended amidst applause.

ハムスン [ローマ字](hamusun)

ハムスター [ローマ字](hamusutā)
【動】 a hamster.
◧ハムスター飼育所　a hamstery.

ハムぞく【ハム族】 [ローマ字](hamuzoku)
〔アフリカ北部・東部の先住民族〕 the Hamites; 〔1 人〕 a Hamite.

ハーン１ [ローマ字](hān)
〔モンゴル・トルコなどの首長〕 a khan.

ハーン２ [ローマ字](hān)
1 Hahn, Otto (1879-1968; ドイツの化学者).
2 Hearn, Lafcadio (1850-1904; 日本に帰化した著述家; 日本名は小泉八雲).

はん１【反】 [ローマ字](han)
【論】 the antithesis 《pl. -ses》. [⇒はん-１]

はん２【半】 [ローマ字](han)
1 〔半分〕 (a) half; 〔なかば〕 half. [⇒はん-２]
►9 時半　half past nine; *half after nine
・1 時間半　an hour and a half; one and a half hours
・2 キロ半　two and a half kilometers; two kilometers and a half
・1 倍半　one and a half times; half as ┏much [many] again 《as…》; half again as ┏many [much] 《as…》
・1 ダース半　a dozen and a half.
►半キロ　half a kilometer; *a half kilometer.
2 〔奇数〕 an odd number.
►丁か半か　odd or even.

はん３【犯】 [ローマ字](han)
an offense. [⇒-はん]
►犯をおかす　commit an offense 《against…》.

はん４【判】 [ローマ字](han)
1 〔印判〕 a stamp; a seal; *a handstamp; 〔印影〕 a seal; 《bear》 the impression of a ┏seal [stamp]; sb's mark.
►安田氏の判が押してある　have Mr. Yasuda's seal on 《it》; 《文》 bear [be affixed with] the seal of Mr. Yasuda
・部長の判がないとこれは注文できない.　We can't order this unless the form has the manager's ┏seal [stamp] on it.
►判で押したような　〔紋切り型の〕 stereotyped; cut-and-dried; cut-and-dry
・判で押したように　invariably; with perfect regularity; without (an) exception; like clockwork
・彼は判で押したように 8 時にやって来る.　He ┏always [invariably] turns up spot on eight. ｜ He always arrives like clockwork at eight o'clock.
►判を押す　put ┏a [one's] seal 《on a document》; stamp 《a form》 with ┏a [one's] seal; 《文》 affix a ┏seal [stamp] 《to a bond》
・部長の判をもらってきなさい.　Go and get the manager's ┏seal [stamp] on it. ｜ Get the manager to put his seal on it.
・判を彫る　engrave a seal.
2 〔紙や本の判型〕 a format.
►A4判　A4
・新書判　(a) shinsho format [⇒しんしょばん]
・二つ[四つ, 八つ]切り判　folio [quarto, octavo].
►大[小]判の罫紙　large-[small-]sized ruled paper.
◧判型　⇒はんがた.

つまぐろよこばい【褄黒横這】 [ローマ字](tsumaguroyokobai)
【昆】 〔ヨコバイ科の昆虫〕 a green rice leafhopper; Nephotettix cincticeps.

はん６【班】 [ローマ字](han)
1 【軍】 a corps [kɔː] 《pl. corps [kɔːz]》; a squad.
►第 3 中隊第 1班　the first squad of the 3rd company.
2 〔組・仲間〕 a group; a team; a party; a company; a set.

はん７【斑】 [ローマ字](han)
a spot. [⇒はんてん４]

はん８【煩】 [ローマ字](han)
trouble; worry.

►煩をいとう　be sparing of ┏labor [pains]; spare the trouble 《of doing》
・煩をいとわず　not minding the trouble
・煩を省く　〈事が主語〉 save sb trouble.

はん９【範】 [ローマ字](han)
an example; a model; a pattern.
►範を示す[垂れる]　set [be, give, offer] an example 《to…》
・範を採る[にならう]　follow [copy] sb's example; take sb as an example
・米国の制度に範を採る　be modeled ┏on [after] the American system.

はん１０【繁】 [ローマ字](han)
〔頻繁〕 frequency; 〔複雑〕 complexity; 〔面倒〕 trouble.
►繁より簡に入る　proceed from the complex to the simple.
►繁を避けて　for the sake of brevity.

はん１１【藩】 [ローマ字](han)
a han; a (feudal) domain; a fief; a province; 〔領主の一族〕 a (feudal) clan.
►加賀藩　the Kaga han; the Kaga domain; the fief of Kaga.
・その地区の警備は会津藩の担当だった.　Security in that area was handled by the Aizu domain.
・薩摩藩と長州藩が同盟を結んだ.　The Satsuma and Chōshū clans formed an alliance.

anti-.

はん-２【半-】 [ローマ字](han-)

・半神　a demigod
・半長靴　half boots
・半杯　half a ┏cup [glass]
・半病人　a semi-invalid; a person who is not fully fit

・半カット　a half 《melon》

はん-３【汎-】 [ローマ字](han-)

はな１【花・華】 [ローマ字](hana)
1 【花】 〔草木の〕 (一般に, また特に観賞花) a flower; 〔果樹の〕 a blossom.
►切りたての花　fresh(ly cut) flowers
・生の花　a ┏fresh [live] flower
・鉢植えの花　potted flowers
・大輪の花　a ┏large [broad-petaled] flower
・バラの花　a rose
・枯れた花　a withered flower.
►花1 輪　a flower
・花1 束　a ┏cluster [bunch] of flowers
・花1 枝　a spray of flowers.
►花が咲く.　Flowers open. ｜ Trees ┏blossom [bloom]. ｜ Buds come into ┏flower [bloom].
・ヒガンバナは葉が出るより先に花が咲く.　Red spider lilies blossom before the leaves come out.
・イネにも花が咲くのよ.　You know that rice plants flower too.
・花が咲いている.　The flowers are out. ｜ The tree is in ┏flower [bloom].
・この木にはたくさん花が咲いている.　This tree bears many blossoms.
・この朝顔はもう花が咲かない.　This morning glory is past blooming.
・花が長持ちする.　The flowers ┏last for quite a while [are quite durable].
・花が散った.　The flowers ┏have fallen [are gone]. ｜ The tree is out of ┏flower [bloom].
・花がしぼむ.　The flowers ┏wither [shrivel].
・花が実となる.　A blossom develops into fruit.
►花に水をやる　water the flowers.
►花の　floral
・花の図案[装飾]　floral ┏designs [decorations]
・花のトンネル　an avenue of blossoming trees
・花の贈り物　a floral gift
・花のような　flowery; flowerlike
・花のような少女　a girl (as) pretty as a flower; a girl (as) fair as a May rose; a blooming girl
・花のある暮らし　a life(style) enhanced by flowers; living among flowers
・花のない枝　a branch without blossoms; a flowerless branch
・花のない季節　a flowerless season; winter
・この花は花の時期が長い.　This flower stays in bloom for a long while.
・花の咲いている木　a blossoming tree; a tree in flower
・花の咲く草木　a flowering plant
・花の咲くころ　the flower season
・花の命は短くて苦しきことのみ多かりき　〔林芙美子の語〕 Like a flower's, this life is short and filled with pain.
►花を摘む　pluck [pick, gather] flowers
・花を切る　cut a flower
・花を手(た)折る　break off a spray of flowers
・花を植える[作る]　raise [grow] flowers
・花をつける　〔木や草が〕 put forth flowers; come into flower
・花を咲かせる　make flowers ┏open [bloom]
・玄関に花を飾る　decorate an entrance with flowers
・墓に花を手向ける　offer a bunch of flowers before a tombstone
・記念碑に花を捧げる　place a floral tribute at the foot of a monument.
►お花はいかが.　Flowers to sell!
・花は桜木 人は武士.　〔「すぐれている」の意味で〕 The cherry among blossoms, the samurai among men. ｜ 〔「潔い」の意味で〕 As the cherry blossoms know their time to fall, so the samurai is ever prepared to meet his fate.
・いい香りの花だね.　These flowers have a lovely smell.
・ヒマワリは夏の花だ.　The sunflower is a summer flower.
・隣の花は赤い.　The flowers are always ┏redder [brighter] in the neighbor's yard.
・彼女は花も恥じらう 17 歳だ.　She's now 17 and so charming that even the flowers feel ashamed of their appearance.
さし絵　（はな）
2 【花】 〔桜〕 cherry blossoms.
►花の雲　a cloud of cherry blossoms
・花の便り　news of the blooming of the cherries
・京都から花の便りが届きました.　Word came from Kyoto that the cherries had started to bloom.
・花の宴(うたげ)　a cherry-viewing ┏party [banquet].
►日本人には花をめでる習慣がある.　Japanese have always been taken with the cherry blossoms.
・今年はどこの花を見に行こうか.　Where shall we go to view the cherries this year?
►上野の花は今が見頃だ.　The cherry blossoms at Ueno are at their best now.
3 【花】 〔花に似た形のもの〕 flowerlike; flower-shaped.
►波の花　wave caps resembling flowers
・雪の花　〔雪の一片〕 a ┏flake [crystal] of snow; a snowflake; 〔花のように積もった雪〕 a flowerlike pattern in the (fallen) snow.
►霜が降りて草原に花が咲いた.　The frost made flowerlike patterns on the steppes.
4 【花・華】 〔花に似て華やかなもの〕 a shining example 《of…》; the ┏flower [pride, pearl, pick, glory] 《of…》.
►武士道の華　the flower of ┏bushidō [chivalry].
►彼女には言うに言われぬ華がある.　She just has a certain something about her (that is very appealing).
►花のお江戸　the ┏fine [resplendent] city of Edo
・花の都パリ　the gay city of Paris; gay Paris
・花の独身　one in the flower of bachelorhood
・花の金曜日　Thank God it's Friday! ｜ TGIF
・花のある人　one with a sparkling ┏personality [aura].
►火事とけんかは江戸の華.　Fires and quarrels were salient among the Edo entertainments.
・彼女は一行の華だった.　She was the rose of the party.
・陸上競技の華とも言うべきマラソンは大会最終日に行われます.　The marathon, the centerpiece of track and field, is held on the last day of the meet.
5 【花】 〔女性のたとえ〕 a ┏fair [lovely] woman.
►主(あるじ)ある花　a married beauty
・社交界の花　a prominent society woman; the belle of society
・職場の花　the ┏flower [belle] of the ┏workplace [office, factory floor]
・壁の花　〔舞踏会で取り残された〕 a wallflower
・高嶺(たかね)の花　⇒たかね３
・両手に花　with a beauty on either arm.
6 【花】 〔最上の時〕 best ┏days [times].
►人生の花　the flower of ┏life [youth]; the golden season of life; the springtime of life
・ひと花咲かせる　make a splash; do something to make the world sit up and take notice; make a name for oneself.
►彼女はあたら盛りの花を散らした.　She was cut off in the flower of her prime.
►花も嵐も踏み越えて　for better or for worse; through ┏fair and foul [thick and thin].
►若いうちが花だ.　You're only young once.
・彼は今が盛りの花だ.　He is in the glory of his prime.
・あの人もあの頃が花だった.　He was in his best days then. ｜ Those were his best days.
・知ってしまえばそれまで, 知らないうちが花.　Happiness is [One is better off] not knowing.
7 【花】 〔生け花〕 flower ┏arrangement [arranging].
►お花の先生　a teacher of flower arrangement.
►花を活(い)ける　arrange flowers; put flowers in 《a vase》
・お花を習う　take lessons in flower arrangement.
8 〔花札〕 a deck of Japanese playing cards with 12 suits of 4 cards, each suit representing a month of the year signified by a flower.
►花を引く　play cards.
言わぬが花　Better leave it unsaid. ｜ It is best left unsaid. ｜ The less said (about it) the better. ｜ Silence is golden [gold]. 【諺】
花が咲く　1 〔話などが盛んになる〕 《have the conversation》 become ┏lively [animated].
►昔話に花が咲く　grow warm with past reminiscences.
2 〔栄える〕 bloom; flower; reach a zenith; grow resplendent.
►また花が咲く時節もあるかもしれませんよ.　Let us hope that there are still good times ahead of us.
花と咲く　open like cherry blossoms.
►にわか雨の交差点に色とりどりの傘が花と咲いた.　Umbrellas opened like cherry blossoms as a sudden rain pelted the intersection.
花と散る　fall [scatter] like cherry blossoms
・ここは戦争であたら若い命を花と散らした画学生の遺作を集めた美術館です.　This is a museum devoted to works left by art students who, during the war, fell like cherry blossoms in the spring of their youth.
花に風[嵐].　The cherries blossom only to scatter on the wind. ｜ 〔いいことは長く続かない〕 Good things don't last.
花開く　bloom; blossom; flower; come into ┏flower [bloom]; effloresce.
►18 世紀には宮廷文化が花開いた.　In the 18th century, court culture blossomed.
花も実もある　have both looks and substance; be sound inside and out; 〔道理も人情も〕 be both just and compassionate.
►学者としての彼の生涯は花も実もあるものであったと言えよう.　It would be fair to say that his life as a scholar saw both fame and accomplishment.
・花も実もある判決　a fair yet compassionate verdict.
花より団子　Dumplings rather than blossoms. ｜ Bread is better than the song of the birds.
花を咲かせる　1 〔話などを盛り上がらせる〕 animate [enliven] 《a conversation》; discourse eloquently.
►思い出話に花を咲かせる　reminisce with feeling.
2 〔栄えさせる〕 cause to bloom; succeed; put a finishing touch on 《one's career》.
►今一度花を咲かせる　have a fair comeback
・引退する前に優勝して今一度花を咲かせたい.　I'd like to win one last time and go out a winner.
花を持たせる　save sb's face; let sb have the credit for 《the success》; shift the credit on to sb.
►〔演劇部の配役決めで〕 今回は卒業してゆく 3 年生に花を持たせよう.　Let's give the graduating students a chance to shine (in the play).
花を添える　decorate; grace; make colorful; add a ┏graceful [colorful] touch 《to…》.
►はつらつとしたバトンガールたちが開会式に花を添えた.　The lively baton twirlers added a special touch to the opening ceremony.
・錦上さらに花を添える　⇒きんじょう４.

・強固な反対を受ける　meet with [run into] opposition; be opposed 《by…》

はる２【張る】 [ローマ字](haru)
1 〔伸ばし広げる〕 stretch; spread; 〔布を〕 full.

►縄を張る　stretch a rope 《between…》; 〔囲いをする〕 rope off 《a place》

3 〔強く引っ張る〕 stretch; tighten; strain.
►ぴんと張った　stretched tight; taut.

►床にタイルを張る　tile a floor; floor 《a room》 with tiles
・壁にベニヤ板を張る　line a wall with veneer
・松材の机にウォルナットを張る　veneer a pine desk with walnut
・革を張ったイス　a chair upholstered ┏in [with] leather; a leather-upholstered chair.
5 【張る・貼る】 〔糊などで貼りつける〕 (紙などを) paste; stick; plaster; affix; (膏薬などを) apply 《to…》; stick; 〔障子などを〕 paper 《a sliding door》; 〔掲示する〕 post [put up] 《a notice》.
►壁にポスターを張る　put up [display] a poster on the wall
・湿布薬を張る　apply a plaster 《to…》; plaster 《a sore place》

►胸を張る　throw out one's chest

►宴(うたげ)を張る　hold [*throw] a banquet

►横綱を張る　hold the rank of yokozuna.

・回転が速い　have a quick turnover

・仕事が速い　be quick ┏with [at, about] one's work; be a quick worker
・ガンの進行が速い　sb's cancer progresses rapidly
・授業の進度が速い　the class moves ahead rapidly
・食べるのが速い　be a ┏quick [fast] eater
・時間のたつのが速い　time passes quickly
・理解が速い　be quick to grasp sth; be quick to learn; be a fast learner
・耳が速い　have sharp hearing
・手が速い　〔仕事が速い〕 be a fast worker; 〔女性にすぐ手を出す〕 be a fast ┏operator [worker]; be fast 《with women》; 〔すぐに暴力を振るう〕 be quick to resort to violence
・対応が速い　be swift to respond 《to customer complaints》
・…するが速いか　no sooner…than; hardly [scarcely]… ┏when [before]

3 【早い】 〔時間が朝だ〕 early (in the ┏day [morning]); 〔標準より前だ〕 early; earlier than usual.

・梅雨入りが早い　the rainy season starts ┏early [earlier than usual].

・君は朝が早いね.　You're really an ┏early riser [early bird], aren't you?
・早い時間なら店もすいてるよ.　If we get there early, it won't be crowded.

・早いほど結構です.　The sooner, the better.
・早い人は朝 5 時から並んでいるそうだ.　I hear that people are standing in line as early as 5 a.m.
・早い者勝ち.　First come, first served. 【諺】
4 【早い】 〔時期尚早だ〕 premature.
►それにはまだ早いよ.　It's still too early (for that).

►速く速く.　Hurry up! ｜ Come on!

2 【早く】 〔早い時に〕 early.
►なるべく早く　as soon as one can; as soon as possible

・早くとも[ても]　at the earliest; at the soonest
・早くとも 7 月末まではかかるでしょう.　It will take until the end of July at the earliest.
・完成は早くても 11 月末と見ています.　We estimate it will take until at least the end of November to finish.
・早くも　⇒はやくも
・遅かれ早かれ　＝そうばん
・早く起きる　get up [rise] early
・早く到着する　arrive ┏early [ahead of schedule]
・(予定の時刻より)10 分早く着く　arrive at 《a place》 ten minutes ahead of time
・一足早く出発する　leave a little earlier than everyone else
・…するより早く　faster than…; in less time than…
・彼は「危ない!」と言うより早く, その子を抱き止めた.　He caught the child in his arms almost before he had time to shout "Watch out!"
►早く試験の結果が知りたい.　I can't wait to find out how I did on the test.
・早くお正月になればいいなあ.　I wish the New Year would come soon.
・彼らは早く夏休みが来るといいと思っている.　They are looking forward to (the) summer vacation.
・一刻も早く!　There's no time to lose. ｜ Not a moment is to be lost.
3 【早く】 〔早い時期〕
►早く死ぬ　die young
・早く世に出る　be successful early in life
・朝早くに　early in the morning.
►早くから　from an early period; from early on; from early in one's ┏life [career]
・朝早くから夜遅くまで　from early morning till late at night
・座席は早くから詰めかけた観客でいっぱいだった.　The seats were filled with spectators who had been coming in from early on.
・あなたはどれくらい早くから並んでいるの?　How long have you been ┏waiting [standing] in line?
►彼女は早く(に)両親を失った.　She lost her parents at an early age.
・早くそう言ってよ.　You should have told me (long) before this. ｜ You should have said so long ago.
速くする・早くする　increase 《the pace》; hasten.
►もっとテンポを速くして!　Increase the tempo.
・早くしろ!　Hurry up! ｜ Be quick! ｜ *Make it snappy! ｜ *Step on it! ｜ *Get a move on! ｜ Look alive!
・できるだけ早くいたしましょう.　I'll do it the first chance I get.
速くなる・早くなる　be ┏faster [earlier] (than usual).

・計算が速くなるこつはありますか?　Is there some secret to being quick with figures?
・このところ日の入りが早くなった.　The sun has started setting earlier recently.

1 〔くぼませる〕 dent; indent; depress; make hollow.
►頬をへこませる　draw one's cheeks in

►こねた生地を一口大に丸め, 真ん中を指で押して軽くへこませます.　Form the dough into bite-sized balls, then press each one down slightly in the middle with your finger.
・後ろから追突されてバンパーをへこまされた.　I got hit from the back and my bumper was dented.
2 〔やりこめる〕 snub; put down; beat sb hollow; squelch; tame; stump; (言い負かす) silence; (高慢の鼻を折る) humble; humiliate.
►へこまされる　be snubbed; be stumped; be floored; be silenced.
►意地の悪い質問をして教師をへこましてやった.　I asked a cheeky question, which put the teacher on the spot.
・あいつをへこましてやった.　I had him there.
・パソコンのことではしょっちゅう娘にへこまされている.　When it comes to computers, I'm constantly being floored by my daughter.

へん１【辺】 [ローマ字](hen)
1 〔漠然とした場所〕 a part; a locality; a region; a district; 〔方面〕 a direction; a quarter; 〔付近〕 a neighborhood; a vicinity.
►景色もいいし, この辺でお昼にしよう.　It's a nice view, so let's have lunch around here.
►この辺に郵便局はないですか.　Is there a post office near here?
・この辺に私の眼鏡置いてなかった?　Didn't I leave my glasses here somewhere?
・テレビのリモコンならどっかその辺にあるだろ.　If it's the TV remote control you want, it must be somewhere over there.
►この辺の寿司屋にはろくなのがない.　There are no good sushi shops around here. ｜ You can't get good sushi anywhere in this neighborhood.
►ちょっとその辺をぶらぶらしてくるよ.　Let's go for a little stroll (around the neighborhood).
►この辺は閑静だ.　This is a quiet neighborhood.
・彼の家はたしかこの辺だったと思う.　I'm pretty sure his house was somewhere about here.
・この辺はどうも不案内です.　I am quite a stranger ┏in these parts [in this neighborhood].
・夫の乗った船は今ごろどの辺だろう.　I wonder whereabouts the ship my husband is on will be now.
2 〔漠然とした事情・程度〕
►この辺でお開きにしましょう.　It's time to bring this event to a close.
・明日が早いので今夜はこの辺で失礼します.　I have to get up early tomorrow, so I'll say my goodbyes now.
►数はまずその辺のところと見ていいだろう.　They seem to be approximate figures.
・その辺の事情は判然としない.　I am not quite sure of it.
►彼も苦しいんだよ. その辺を理解してやれよ.　It's hard for him, too. Please understand that.
►まずその辺だろう.　That's about it. ｜ You are about right.
・今日はこの辺までにしておきましょう.　So much for today.
3 〔多角形の各線分〕 a side; a member.
►三角形の 3辺　the three sides of a triangle
・台形の向かい合った 2辺　the two opposing sides of a trapezoid
・その角に対する辺　⇒かく１ 1
・2 角とその間の辺　two angles and the included side
・2辺とそのはさむ角　two sides and the included angle.
►1 辺が 2 センチの正方形　a square with one side 2 cm in length.
►3 辺の長さの合計　the sum of the lengths of three sides.
►斜辺の長さが c, 角 A に対する辺の長さが a, それに隣接する辺の長さが b の直角三角形　a right triangle with hypotenuse of length c, side opposite A of length a, and side adjacent of length b.

へる２【減る】 [ローマ字](heru)
1 〔減少する〕 decrease; diminish; lessen; fall (off); drop off; (次第に) dwindle; run low; sink; abate; subside; 〔軽減する〕 become lighter; be alleviated.
►貯水池の水が減った.　The water in the reservoir has fallen.
・彼が入った後で風呂の湯がめっきり減っていた.　After he had taken his bath, ┏there was far less water left [the water was much lower].
・ガソリンが減ってきた.　The gas is running low. ｜ We are running short of gas.
・最近彼は食事[酒]の量が減った.　Recently his consumption of ┏food [alcohol] has decreased.
・このダイエット法では身体の脂肪は減っても筋肉は変わらない.　With this diet, your body fat will decrease, while your muscles will not change.
・体重が 4 キロ減った.　My weight has gone down by four kilograms. ｜ I have lost four kilograms (in weight).
・体重[体脂肪]がちっとも減らない.　My ┏weight [body fat] hasn't dropped at all.
・貯金が減って 2 万円しかない.　My savings have gone down to no more than \20,000.
・ボーナスが去年より 1 割減った.　My bonus has gone down (by) 10 percent compared with last year.
・昔に比べると魅力的な俳優が減った.　Compared with the old days, there aren't so many attractive actors.
・あの店はお客が減っている.　That shop's clientele has dropped off.
・日本では子供の数が減っている.　In Japan the number of children is on the decline.
・100 人いた兵士は激戦で 10 人に減った.　In heavy fighting, 100 soldiers were thinned down to ten.
・仲間が減ってさびしい.　With fewer friends, I'm lonely.
・支持者がこれ以上減ることはないだろう.　Surely our supporters will not ┏fall [drop] off any further.
・旅行の機会が減った.　I now have fewer opportunities to travel.
・外出(の回数)が減り家にいることが多くなった.　I have been going out less and staying at home more.
・どうしたら交通事故が減るのだろうか.　How can traffic accidents be reduced (in number)?
・鉄鋼の需要が減ってきた.　The demand for steel is on the decrease.
・この安全装置のおかげで飛行機事故の危険は減るだろう.　With the help of this safety device, the risk of airplane accidents will be reduced.
・人手が増えても私の負担は減らない.　Even with personnel increasing, my own burden has not decreased.
・退職をしたらストレスが減って太ってしまった.　After I retired, I was under less stress and put on weight.
・この薬を飲んだら胃の痛みが減った.　When I took this medicine, the pain in my stomach diminished.
・最近カニの水揚げが減った.　Catches of crab have fallen off recently.
・今年は米の収穫が 1 割減ってしまった.　This year's rice harvest fell (by) ten percent.
・その国は人口が減っている.　The country's population is falling.
・口が減らないやつだ.　He always has a ready comeback for anything.
2 〔摩耗する〕 wear (and tear).
►ペン先が減っている.　The end of my pen is worn down.
・靴底がすっかり減ってしまった.　My soles of shoes are worn (right) out.
3 〔空腹になる〕
►腹が減る　get hungry.
►まだ腹は減っていない.　I'm not hungry yet.

►ひどい仕打ち　cruel [harsh, nasty] treatment; (a) cruelty
・ひどいやり方　a ┏cruel [harsh] way of doing [method]
・ひどいことを言う　say something ┏terrible [horrible, cruel]
・そんなにひどいことを言いましたか.　Was I really [Did I really say something] that nasty [so cruel]?
・ひどい目　⇒ひどいめ.
►それではあんまりひどいじゃないか.　Don't be so ┏cruel [nasty]! ｜ You are being horrible.
・そんなことをするなんてひどすぎる.　That's [That would be] too ┏much [cruel, horrible]. ｜ Nobody should do that to anyone.
・そんなことを言うなんて, ひどい男だ.　It was ┏mean [nasty, cruel] of him to say that. ｜ He's a ┏brute [bastard] to have said that.
・ずいぶんひどい話だな.　That's ┏brutal [really nasty].
・なんてひどいやつだ.　What a ┏beast [bastard, horrible guy]!
・1 時間も待たせるなんてひどいわ.　What do you mean by keeping me waiting a whole hour! ｜ Keeping a person waiting an hour! It's ┏too much [cruel]!
・いくらなんでもそりゃひどい, 勘弁してくれよ.　Come off it! You can't ┏be serious [expect me to do that]! ｜ That's ridiculous! You must be joking! ｜ You can't do that (to people)!
2 〔極端に激しい〕 extreme; 〔大変な〕 terrible; dreadful; horrible; atrocious; abominable; 〔法外な〕 exorbitant; extraordinary; outrageous; egregious; unreasonable; ridiculous; absurd; ᐦ《口》 (a bit, rather, a little too) thick. [⇒ひどく２]
►ひどい暴風　a ┏severe [heavy, violent, terrible] storm
・ひどい風　a ┏violent [terrible] wind
・ひどい雨　heavy ┏rain [rainfall]; terrible rain; a ┏heavy [terrible] downpour
・ひどい雪　heavy snow; a heavy snowfall
・ひどい風邪　a ┏bad [nasty, terrible, horrible] cold
・ひどい寒さ　severe [intense, bitter] cold
・ひどい悪臭　a terrible smell; a stink
・ひどい要求をする　make ┏exorbitant [extreme, totally unrealistic] demands
・ひどい批評をする　criticize bitterly.
►ひどい暑さだ.　It is ┏horribly [terribly] hot. ｜ The heat is terrible.
・ひどい天気だった.　The weather has been ┏horrible [terrible, atrocious, abominable]. ｜ We've had appalling weather.
・私はひどい近眼だ.　I'm ┏terribly [dreadfully, atrociously] near-sighted.
・ひどい遅刻をしてしまった.　I was terribly late.
・ここは騒音がひどい.　The noise here is (absolutely) ┏terrible [intolerable].
・きのうから頭痛がひどい.　I've had ┏a terrible [an atrocious] headache since yesterday.
・ひどい混雑だ.　What a ┏crowd [crush]!
・あの病院はひどいときには 3 時間も患者を待たせる.　That hospital is terrible; they sometimes keep patients waiting as long as three hours.
3 〔極端に悪い〕 extremely bad; atrocious; 《文》 execrable; 《口》 grizzly; grotesque; 〔お粗末な〕 gross; rough.
►ひどい道　a bad [an execrable] road
・ひどい出来ばえ　terrible [atrocious] workmanship
・ひどい間違いをしでかす　make a ┏terrible [gross] mistake
・ひどい服装をしている　be wearing terrible clothes; be ┏terribly [appallingly] dressed; look terribly shabby.
►その上着はひどいしろものだ.　That coat is ┏dreadful [a horror].
・テストの結果はひどいものだった.　The test results were ┏terrible [awful, appalling].
・この料理, ひどい味だな.　This food ┏is [tastes] terrible! ｜ This is uneatable, isn't it!
・部屋は散らかり放題でひどいことになっていた.　The room was in a terrible state, with everything left lying around. ｜ The room was in a state of ┏appalling [total] chaos [confusion].
・失敗したらひどいことになりかねない.　If ┏I fail [it doesn't come off], things could be very tough (for me) [I could have a very hard time].
ひどさ　〔むごさ〕 cruelty; harshness; injustice; wrong; unfairness; inhumanity; immorality; beastliness; nastiness; 〔激しさ〕 severity; violence; atrociousness; extremity; exorbitance; outrageousness; absurdity; 〔程度の悪さ〕 a terrible state; a grotesque state of affairs.

・比較すべきものがない　be not comparable 《to [with]…》; be not like ┏anything [anyone] else; have no parallel; be unique; 《文》 be unparalleled; stand unrival(l)ed; be ┏without [beyond, past] compare
・A と B を比較して決める　compare A and B and decide; decide after a comparison of A and B
・私は翻訳を原文と比較してみた.　I have compared the translation with the original.

・これはそれとは比較にならない.　This cannot ┏bear [stand] comparison with that. ｜ This is not to be compared with that. ｜ This cannot compare with that.
・私は彼とはてんで比較にならない.　I just can't compare with him. ｜ I am no match for him at all. ｜ I'm just not in the same ┏class [league] as him. ｜ He is infinitely better than me.

ひっかかり【引っ掛かり】 [ローマ字](hikkakari)
1 〔突起〕 a ┏projection [protuberance] that affords a finger grip; 〔くぼみ〕 a ┏depression [hollow] that affords a finger grip.
2 〔釈然としない気分〕 a doubt; a hesitation.
►ここで承諾するには引っかかりがある.　Accepting at this juncture just doesn't strike me as the right thing to do.

4 〔関わり〕 (a) connection; (a) relation.

・あの家は私のところと多少引っかかりがある.　His family is in some way related to ours.
・その事情を調べようにもどうにも引っかかりがない.　We have no handle that would allow us to look into the circumstances.

ひっかかる【引っ掛かる】 [ローマ字](hikkakaru)
1 〔止められる〕 catch; be caught 《in…, by…》; hitch 《on a nail》; get fast 《in…》; 〔下がる〕 hang; (釣り針などに) be hooked; snag; be snagged 《by…》; 〔引きずられる〕 drag; be dragged 《by…》.
►網に引っかかる　be caught in a net
・棒の先に引っかかる　get caught on the end of a stick.
►喉に魚の小骨が引っかかった.　I got a little fishbone stuck in my throat.
・何かが引っかかってプリンターが動かない.　The printer won't work―something is stuck.
・コートの袖(そで)が釘に引っかかった.　My coatsleeve got caught on a nail.
・凧(たこ)が木[電線]に引っかかった.　The kite got caught ┏in a tree [on an electric wire].
・このペンは引っかかってよく書けない.　This pen keeps catching; it doesn't write smoothly.
・風で飛んだタオルがあんなところに引っかかっている.　Look at where the towel got caught after the wind took it.
2 〔足止めされる〕 be stopped; be held up; get stuck; (立ち寄って) (be persuaded to) stop ┏by [in]; 〔捕まる〕 be caught; 〔チェックされる〕 be ┏checked [inspected]; attract the notice of 《inspectors》.
►検問に引っかかる　be stopped for inspection
・税関で引っかかる　be caught at Customs

・捜査の網に引っかかる　be caught in the investigative net
・健康診断で引っかかる　have a problem turn up in the results of one's health check-up.
►どこで引っかかっているんでしょうか, 主人はまだ帰りません.　I can't imagine where he could've gotten held up, but my husband isn't home yet.
・(試験の) 1 問目で引っかかって時間をだいぶ取られた.　I got stuck on the first exam question and lost a lot of time.
3 〔わなにかかる〕 be trapped; be caught; 〔だまされる〕 be cheated; be tricked; be taken in; fall for…; 《俗》 get sucked 《in…》; 〔関わり合う〕 get entangled 《with…》; be ┏implicated [involved] 《in…》.
►誘導尋問に引っかかる　be trapped by the (attorney's) leading questions
・トリックに引っかかる　be taken in by a trick
・悪い奴に引っかかる　get entangled with [get into the clutches of] a bad man.
►こんな悪巧みには引っかからないぞ.　I'm not going to fall for that sort of trick.
・まんまと(わなに)引っかかった.　He fell right into the trap. ｜ He fell for it, hook, line and sinker.
4 〔釈然としない〕 trouble [weigh upon] one's mind.
►彼女の言動はどうも引っかかる.　Something is bothering me about the way she's behaving.
・この一点が私には引っかかってまだ承諾できない.　I haven't said yes because this one point sticks in my craw.
・頭の片隅に引っかかるものがあった.　Something at the back of my mind was bothering me.

1 〔上下が逆になる〕 be reversed; be overturned; be upset; (船などが) turn turtle; capsize; 〔倒れる〕 fall [tumble] down; be upset; topple over [down]; collapse; (仰向けに) lie down on one's back.

・私は驚きのあまり引っくり返りそうになった.　I thought I was going to topple over in surprise.
・そうなったら世の中が引っ繰り返るような騒ぎになる.　Then the world would be turned topsy-turvy.
・それは天地が引っ繰り返るような大事件だった.　It was an event to turn the world on its ear.
・社長の急死で社内は引っ繰り返るような騒ぎだった.　The president's sudden death threw the company into utter confusion.
2 〔逆転する〕 be reversed.
►形勢が引っくり返った.　The situation was reversed. ｜ The tables were turned 《in our favor》.
・試合が引っくり返った.　The game ┏turned around [ended in a big reversal].

ひく１【引く】 [ローマ字](hiku)
1 〔引っ張る〕 pull; haul; tug; 〔手前に寄せる〕 draw; pull (close); 〔誘導する〕 lead; admit; conduct; (人の手を) lead; (牛馬を) lead 《a horse》.
►ぐいと引く　jerk; give a sharp tug
・いすを後ろに引く　pull a chair out
・カーテンを引く　〔閉める〕 draw a curtain
・サイドブレーキを引く　set the parking brake
・網を引く　haul [draw] in a net
・ドアを引いて開ける　pull a door open
・子どもの手を引く　lead a child by the hand
・ホースで水を引く　bring [supply] water 《to a place》 by hose
・田に水を引く　irrigate a rice field
・貯水池から生活用水を引く　get one's household water supply from a reservoir.
►このひもを引くと電気がつきます.　Pull this cord to turn on the light.
・〔釣りで〕 ほら, 引いてますよ.　Look, you have a bite.
・引(ひく).　〔表示〕 Pull.
2 〔引きずる〕 drag; draggle; 〔連結させて進む〕 pull; haul; draw.
►すそを引いて歩く　walk trailing one's skirt(s)
・トランクを引いて歩く　walk dragging a suitcase
・機関車が客車を引く　a locomotive ┏hauls [pulls] passenger cars
・屋台を引く　pull [draw] a food cart
・犬にそりを引かせる　have dogs pull a sled.
►彼は負傷した右足を引くようにして歩いた.　He walked dragging his injured right leg.
・彼女は子供のころに受けた心の傷がまだ尾を引いている.　She still feels the pain of her childhood trauma.
3 〔線状に描く〕 draw 《a line》; 〔音声を長く伸ばす〕 hold 《a musical note》.
►補助線を引く　【数】 draw an additional line
・図面を引く　draw a plan
・高音を引いて歌う　hold the high notes.
►流れ星が長く尾を引いた.　The falling star had a long trail.
4 〔敷設する〕 lay on 《gas, water》; install 《a telephone》.
►各部屋に水道とガスを引く　equip all the rooms with gas and running water
・ケーブルを引く　get 《broadband》 cable installed.
►山小屋には電気が引かれていなかった.　There was no electricity at the mountain hut.
5 〔塗り広げる〕 lay on; apply; daub; (油を) oil; (ワックスを) wax.
►床にワックスを引く　wax a floor
・熱したフライパンに油を引く　grease a hot frying pan
・唇に紅を引く　put on lip rouge.
►この紙は渋が引いてある.　This paper is tanned.
6 〔引用する〕 cite; quote; refer to….
►テニスンから引いた句　a quotation [a line quoted] from Tennyson
・冒頭に藤村の詩の一節を引く　open by quoting a passage from one of Tōson's poems
・例を引いて解説する　give an explanation citing examples.
7 〔選び出す〕 select; 〔調べる〕 look up; consult.
►トランプを 1 枚引く　pick a card
・くじを引く　draw lots
・辞書を引く　look in [refer to, check] a dictionary
・辞書で「monad」という単語を引く　look up the word "monad" in a dictionary.
►辞書を何冊も引きまくったがこの文は訳せなかった.　I checked a lot of dictionaries but I couldn't translate this sentence.
8 〔引き算する〕 subtract 《from…》; 〔差を求める〕 deduct [subduct, detract] 《from…》; 〔減額する〕 reduce; abate; cut down; take off; allow discount 《for…》; 〔割引する〕 discount.
►10 から 3 を引く　subtract 3 from 10
・収入から支出を引く　deduct expenses from revenue
・給料の 1 割を引く処分を下す　determine a punishment of a salary reduction of 10 percent.
►13引く8 は 5.　13 minus 8 is 5.
・100 から 7 を順に引いていきなさい.　Please subtract 7 from 100 and keep subtracting 7 from each remainder.
・現金払いなら千円引きます.　\1,000 off with payment in cash.
・これ以上はびた一文引もけません.　I can't take a penny less.
・いくらか引けませんか.　Can't you take something off (the price)?
9 〔関心を向かせる〕 draw; attract; 〔誘い込む〕 invite; appeal 《to…》.
►人目[注意]を引く　attract [draw, call] (sb's [public]) attention
・人々の同情を引く　draw [win, arouse] sb's sympathy
・路上で客を引く　tout [solicit] customers on the street.
►そのポスターが私の目を引いた.　The poster attracted my attention.
・この企画では消費者の興味は引けない.　This plan fails to appeal to the consumer.
10 〔受け継ぐ〕
►平家の血を引く一族　a family descended from the Heike.
►君の絵の才能はお母さんの血を引いているからだね, きっと.　I'll bet you got your talent for drawing from your mother.
・この画家は印象派の流れを引いている.　This painter follows in the tradition of the Impressionists.
11 【日舞】 draw one's arm back (toward the body).

ひく２【引く・退く】 [ローマ字](hiku)
1 〔後退する〕 recede; fall back; 〔興ざめる〕 lose interest.
►1 歩引く　back ┏off [away].
►もう後には引けない.　I won't ┏give [budge] an inch.
・あいつは一旦言い出したら後に引かない.　Once he says something he stands his ground.
・引くに引かれぬ羽目になった.　I am in for it now. ｜ I have gone too far to retreat. ｜ I cannot ┏withdraw [return back] now.
・何事もいざとなると引いてしまうのが私の短所です.　My shortcoming is that I get cold feet when it comes to the real thing.
・突然愛を告白されて引いてしまった.　I recoiled when he blurted out that he loved me.
・ドラマは主人公が魅力的でないと引いちゃうよなあ.　It turns me off if the hero of a show is unattractive.
2 〔後退させる〕 withdraw; 〔片づける〕 clear (away).
►軍を引く　withdraw an army
・陣を引く　pull back (one's position)
・腰を引く　pull in one's stomach
・左足を後ろに引く　step back with the left foot
・皿や茶碗を引く　take [clear] away the dishes.
►引け!　Fall back!
3 〔辞める〕 resign; quit; leave; 〔引退する〕 retire; step down; withdraw.
►その仕事からは手を引いた.　I've pulled out of that job.
・職場を引く　resign [leave, quit] one's job
・現役を引く　retire (from active duty).
►このあたりで身を引くことにしたい.　At this time I would like to step down.
・もうそろそろ会長の座をお引きになったら?　Isn't it about time you resigned the chairmanship?
・今の職を引くに引けない事情がある.　There are reasons I can't get out of this job.
4 〔なくなる〕 recede; ebb; wane.
►潮が引いている.　The tide is ┏going out [on the ebb].
・(洪水の)水が引き始めた.　The water has begun to ┏recede [subside].
・汗が引いた.　My sweat dried.
・熱が引いた.　The fever has ┏dropped [abated].
・なかなか熱が引かない.　My fever just won't go down.
・痛みが引いた.　The pain has ┏gone [eased].
・腫れが引いた.　The swelling has gone down.
・ようやく水が引いた.　At last the water receded.
・恐怖で血の気が引いた.　She turned white with fear. ｜ The color drained from her face in fear.

ひくい【低い】 [ローマ字](hikui)
1 〔位置が下の方にある〕 low; 〔垂直方向に短い〕 short (of stature); low.
►低い山　a low mountain
・背の低い人　a short person
・丈(たけ)の低い木　a short tree
・天井の低い部屋　a room with a low ceiling
・かかとの低い靴　low-heeled shoes
・低い鼻　a flat nose
・低い体勢　《keeping》 a low posture
・(壁の)低い位置に手すりを付ける　put a hand rail low on a wall
・腰の低い　modest; courteous. [⇒こし１ 2]
►僕は子供のころは背が低かった.　I was short as a child.
・この辺は土地が低くて水はけが悪い.　This is a low-lying area so drainage is bad.
・水は低きにつく.　Water finds its level.
2 〔数値が小さい〕 low.
►低い温度　a low temperature
・低い投票率　a ┏low [poor] voter turnout.
►日本は食料の自給率が低い.　Japan's self-sufficiency in food is low.
・今日は気圧が低い.　The atmospheric pressure is low today.
・台湾は緯度が低い.　Taiwan lies at a lower latitude 《than Japan》.
・彼女は女優としてはまだ知名度が低い.　She still has low visibility as an actress.
・この季節は湿度が低くて快適だ.　This is the season when the humidity is comfortably low.
・彼女は血圧が低い.　Her blood pressure is low.
・今年のスイカは糖度が低い.　The sugar content of this year's watermelons is low.
3 〔程度が下である〕 low; low-level; 〔劣っている〕 inferior; 〔卑しい〕 low; humble; mean.
►身分が低い　〔生まれが〕 be of low birth; 〔地位が〕 be of low social position
・経済的地位が低い国　a country low on the economic scale
・次元の低い話　vulgar [common] talk
・程度の低いテレビ番組　a low-quality TV show.
►仕事内容は同じでも, パートは低い評価しか受けられないことが多い.　Often the part-timer will get poor marks, even when doing the same work.
・今回の選挙は国民の関心が低かった.　The citizens had little interest in this election.
・彼の近年の作品はどうもレベルが低い.　The quality of his works recently seems to be low.
4 〔音階が下のほうである〕 low; 〔音量が小さい〕 low; soft.
►低い声で　in an undertone; in a low voice; in ┏whispers [a whisper]; under one's breath; 〚It〛 sotto voce; 〔低音で〕 in a low key
・太くて低い声をしている　have a deep bass voice.
►何か言ったらしいが, 声が低くて何と言ったのかよくわからなかった.　He seems to have said something, but he spoke so softly I didn't catch it.
低く　1 〔下のほうに[で]〕 low; low-lying.
►低くたれこめた雲　low-hanging clouds
・低く地を這(は)うような霧　fog hugging the ground
・ツバメが低く飛んでいるからもうすぐ雨だ.　Rain's coming: the swallows are flying low.
・その木は水面に低く枝を垂れていた.　The branches hung low over the water.
2 〔少なく・小さく〕 low.
►経費を低く見積もる　estimate costs low.
3 〔程度を〕 low.
►彼の態度はどうもわれわれを一段低く見ているようなところがある.　There is something in his attitude that makes it seem that he is looking down on us.
低くする　1 〔位置を〕 lower.
►姿勢を低くする　keep one's head down; get down low
・火災の時は姿勢を低くして逃げてください.　In a fire ┏stay low [keep close to the floor] while escaping.
・カメラの位置を低くする　lower the position of the camera.
2 〔数値を〕 lower; reduce.
►エアコンの設定温度をもっと低くしてください.　Would you please lower the air conditioner temperature?
3 〔音階を下げる〕 lower [drop] 《the pitch》; 〔音量を小さくする〕 lower 《the volume》.
►この曲はキーを低くすれば私にも歌えそうだ.　I could sing this song if you lower the key.
・もう少しテレビの音を低くしなさい.　Turn down the volume on the TV, please.
低くなる　1 〔位置が〕 become ┏low [short].
►土地は川に向かって低くなっていた.　The land fell towards the river.
・いつの間にか私のほうが娘より低くなっていた.　Before I knew it I was shorter than my daughter.
2 〔数値が〕 lower; drop.
►内閣支持率が低くなる　the approval rating for the Cabinet is dropping
・ここ数日で急激に気温が低くなった.　The temperature has plummeted over the past few days.
3 〔音階が下がる〕 lower 《in pitch》; drop; 〔音量が小さくなる〕 lower [decrease] 《in volume》; fade.
►息子の声がこのごろ男らしく低くなってきた.　My son's voice has gotten deeper and more masculine recently.
・私の足音が聞こえたのか, 話し声は急に低くなった.　Suddenly the voice dropped to a murmur, perhaps because he heard the sound of my footsteps.
低さ　lowness; 〔身長の〕 shortness.
►子供たちの理科に対する関心の低さが懸念されている.　Children's lack of interest in science is causing concern.
・生まれの低さゆえに　because of ┏his [her] low birth

・暇を惜しんで勉強する　devote every available moment to one's studies

・彼には金も暇もある.　He has money and ┏time [leisure].
・私は暇はあるが金がない.　I have (free) time, but ┏not [I don't have] money.
・貧乏暇なし.　⇒びんぼう.
2 〔要する時間〕 time; the time ┏required [necessary, it takes].

・忙しくて体を休める暇もない.　I'm so busy (that) I have no time to rest. ｜ I'm too busy to relax.

・今日は(客が来なくて)一日中暇でした.　We had no ┏business [customers] at all today. ｜ Business was very slack all day.

ひみつ【秘密】 [ローマ字](himitsu)
1 〔隠れて行うこと・隠したいこと〕 a secret; 〔知られてはならないこと〕 secrecy.
►重大な秘密　an important secret; something highly confidential
・公然の秘密　an open secret
・二人だけの秘密　a secret between the two of 《them》
・ここだけの秘密　a secret between ┏the two of us [you and me]; 《it is》 just between ourselves; 《it》 mustn't ┏go any further [get out].
►秘密が漏れた.　The secret ┏is [has come, has got] out. ｜ 《口》 The cat is out of the bag.
・秘密が漏れるといけないから　in case ┏it [the secret] gets out; (in order) to prevent any leaks.
►秘密にする[しておく]　keep 《a matter》 ┏secret [private, confidential, dark]; keep 《a matter》 to oneself; keep sth from sb; 《口》 keep sth under ┏wraps [one's hat]
・秘密にしない[しておかない]　do not keep sth secret; make no ┏secret [mystery] of 《a matter》
・このことは秘密にするまでもない.　There's no need to keep this (a) secret. ｜ It is not something that needs to be kept under wraps.
・ここの住所は秘密にしてある.　I keep this address secret. ｜ I don't ┏tell anyone [let anyone know] this address.
・このことは秘密にしておかねばならない.　We must keep this ┏secret [to ourselves]. ｜ This must ┏be kept [remain] a secret. ｜ This matter ┏demands [requires] secrecy.
・事件の真相は完全な秘密にされている.　Complete secrecy is being preserved about the incident. ｜ The incident is being kept completely secret. ｜ Nobody is being allowed to know what really happened.
►秘密の　secret
・秘密の厳守　(maintaining) ┏absolute [strict, the strictest] secrecy [confidentiality]
・秘密の会合　a ┏secret [clandestine] meeting
・秘密の報告　a ┏secret [confidential] report

ひなん１【非難・批難】 [ローマ字](hinan)
〔批判〕 (a) criticism; (an) adverse criticism; 〔とがめ〕 blame 《for…》; (a) reproach; reprobation; (a) censure; strictures; 《文》 castigation; 〔酷評〕 animadversion; (a) diatribe; (a) fulmination; 〔弾劾〕 (a) denunciation; 〔攻撃〕 (an) attack.
〜する 〔批判する〕 criticize; make a criticism; 〔とがめる〕 blame; 《文》 censure; reproach; 〔弾劾する〕 denounce; condemn; 〔誹謗する〕 disparage; 〔攻撃する〕 attack; 《文》 castigate; (激しく) blast; 《文》 excoriate; lambast(e); 〔酷評する〕 animadvert; 〔けなす〕 《文》 decry; run sb down; 《文》 cry out against…; charge 《sb with…》; make charges 《of plagiarism》 against…; 〔こきおろす〕 declaim against…; *lace into sb; 〔責める〕 tax [charge] sb with 《a fault》; accuse sb of 《stupidity》.
►非難すべき　should be criticized; deserve criticism; should not be allowed to go unchallenged; reprehensible; blamable; censurable; blameworthy; reproachable
・彼は何も非難すべき事はしていない.　He didn't do anything ┏reprehensible [deserving reproach].
・彼は首相を非難する演説を行った.　He made a speech ┏attacking [criticizing, that was critical of] the Prime Minister. ｜ He ┏attacked [criticized] the Prime Minister in a speech.
・各紙とも政府の外交政策を一斉に非難した.　All the papers in unison attacked the Government's foreign policy. ｜ All the papers condemned the Government for its foreign policy.
►制度改悪との非難が後を絶たない.　The proposal has been condemned non-stop as a change for the worse. ｜ Accusations that the scheme would simply worsen the situation have been unceasing.
・首相の発言に対し激しい非難がわき上がった.　There were bitter criticisms of the Prime Minister's statement. ｜ The Prime Minister's statement was fiercely ┏attacked [criticized].
►いかなる非難にも堪える　put up with any amount of criticism.
►非難の応酬　an exchange of ┏criticism [reprobation, diatribes, denunciation]
・非難の眼差しを向ける　cast a critical glance at sb; look at sb critically
・非難の声を上げる　unite in attacking…; raise ┏a chorus of criticism [a hue and cry] 《against…》
・増税に対する激しい非難の声が上がった.　A chorus of bitter protest went up against the tax increase. ｜ There was a major hue and cry in opposition to the tax increase.
・非難の的となる　be [get] attacked; be [get] criticized; become the ┏focus [target] of criticism; 《文》 suffer opprobrium 《for doing》
・非難の矢面に立つ　bear the brunt of criticism; be the target of a lot of criticism
・非難の余地がない　be ┏above [beyond] reproach; be ┏impeccable [irreproachable]; have no fault to find with 《sb, sth》
・その点に非難の余地はまったくない.　In that respect ┏he [it] is ┏beyond reproach [perfect, impeccable]. ｜ I ┏can't fault it [have no fault to find with it] in that respect.
・その処置に対しては非難の声が高い.　The measures ┏are being bitterly attacked [have come under severe criticism]. ｜ There is loud opposition to the measures.
►非難を免れない　be open to ┏censure [criticism]
・彼の処置は不公平の非難を免れない.　He will not be able to avoid charges of injustice for the steps he has taken. ｜ The measures he has taken will be open to charges of unfairness. ｜ These steps he has taken are likely be criticized as unfair.
・手ひどい非難を招く　lay oneself open to severe criticism; 《文》 invite ┏heavy [severe] censure
・彼の行動は世間の非難を招いた.　His conduct ┏laid him open [subjected him] to public censure.
・ひどい非難を浴びせる　attack sb ┏roundly [relentlessly]; subject sb to a storm of criticism
・非難を浴びる　be ┏made the focus of [subjected to] attack [criticism]; come under fire; be ┏attacked [criticized].
►審判の判定に対して観客は非難囂々(ごうごう)だった.　There was a storm of protest from the onlookers at the judge's decision.
◧非難合戦　mutual criticism.
►非難合戦をする[繰り広げる]　engage in (a round of) mutual criticism; attack each other.
非難者　a critic; an attacker; 〔検閲者〕 a censor 《of public morals》; 〔告発者〕 an accuser.

►ほかの　other; another; different; else

・(だれか)ほかの人[者]　someone else

ほんとう１【本当】 [ローマ字](hontō)
1 〔真実・事実・実際〕
►本当は　in (point of) fact; actually; in ┏reality [actuality]; really; as a matter of fact; the truth (of the matter) is 《that…》
・それが本当でもうそでも　whether that's ┏the truth or a lie [true or false].
►本当に　〔嘘ではなく〕 truly; really; actually; for real; 〔本気で〕 in (real) earnest [⇒本当に]
・君は本当にそう思ってるのか.　Do you really think that (way)?
・本当にする　believe; take sth seriously; accept sth as true
・人の言うことを本当にする　take sb at his word
・だれがそんな話を本当にするものか.　Who would believe a story like that? ｜ Tell that to the marines!
・本当にそうなのか(＝本気か).　Do you really mean what you say?
・これは去年本当にあったことなんだ.　This (is something that) really happened last year.
►本当の　〔真の〕 true; real; actual; 〔事実上の〕 veritable; 〔実在する〕 substantial
・本当のこと　the truth; a fact; a reality
・本当のことを言えば　to speak the truth; truth to tell; to tell you the truth; in reality
・では本当のことを言います.　Okay, I'll tell you the truth.
・本当のところはどうなんだ?　Now tell me what really happened.
・本当の私[自分]を探す　search for the real me
・本当の友だち　a true friend
・本当の兄弟　one's ┏real [true] brother; full brothers
・本当の悪人　a real rascal
・本当の意味での幸福　happiness in the true sense of the word
・その語の本当の意味において　in the ┏true [truest, real] meaning of the ┏word [term]
・本当の年を教えてください.　Tell me ┏your real age [how old you really are].
・彼は決して本当の気持ちを明かさない.　He never ┏lays bare [gives away] his ┏real [true] feelings.
・この地方の本当の寒さはこんなものじゃない.　This is nothing like how cold it really gets in these parts.
・あれこそ本当の芸人だ.　Now that's what I call a real entertainer!
►本当だね.　〔同意して〕 I agree with you. ｜ 〔念を押して〕 You're not kidding me now, are you?
・それって本当?　Can it be true? ｜ Is that really true?
・〔驚いて〕 本当ですか.　Really? ｜ Really and truly? ｜ 〔まさか!〕 You don't say! ｜ You're kidding.
・本当かどうかわからないことを人に言うものではない.　Never say anything that you don't know ┏to be true [for certain].
・彼の言っていることは本当らしい.　He seems to be telling the truth.
・本当言うと私は彼が好きじゃないんだ.　To tell the truth, I don't like him.
・本当は彼は解雇されたのだ.　The truth is, he was fired.
・「急がば回れ」とは本当だ.　"Make haste slowly"―truer words were never spoken.
・大丈夫, それは本当だよ.　Take it from me [Take my word for it], it's true.
・彼女離婚だって, 本当だよ.　You know the rumor that she's getting divorced? Well, it's true.
・私はそんなことはしていません, 本当です.　I didn't do it; on my word of honor.
・彼女にちょっと仕事を教えてもらってただけなんだ. 本当だってば.　She was only explaining to me what I have to do in my job, that's all. Honestly.
2 〔本来・本筋〕
►本当の　〔正しい〕 proper; right
・それが本当のやり方だ.　That's the ┏proper [right] way to go about it.
►本当を言えば　properly speaking; to speak properly
・本当を言えばこれは論理学の題目だ.　Properly speaking, this subject belongs to logic.
►…と呼ぶのが本当だろう.　It would be proper to call it….
・体調はまだ本当ではない.　I'm not fully recovered yet. ｜ I'm still not quite my old self.
・本当はそんなことはできないのだが….　Strictly speaking, that's not supposed to be done, but….
・本当はこれは松でこしらえるべきなんだが.　By rights, this should be made of pine(wood).
・本当はまだ安静にしてなくちゃいけないんだけど.　I'm supposed to still be ┏resting [staying] in bed.
3 〔本物〕
►本当の　genuine; authentic; 〔人工的でない〕 natural
・本当の真珠　a natural pearl; 〔にせ物ではない〕 a ┏real [genuine] pearl
・この造花はまるで本当の花のようだ.　This artificial flower looks just like a real one.
本当に　〔まったく, 実に〕 really; quite; indeed; very.
►君が来てくれて本当によかった.　It was a good thing (that) you came. ｜ Am I (ever) glad you came!
・彼は本当に気が利いている.　He's a really thoughtful person.
・本当に美しい風景だった.　The scene was really beautiful.
・本当に寒いね.　Boy, it's really cold!
・本当にくやしい.　I could really kick myself.
・本当におもしろかった.　We've had a rattling good time.
・本当にありがとう.　Thank you very much indeed.

い１０【意】 [ローマ字](i)
1 〔心・気持ち〕 mind; heart; emotion; feeling; 〔思い〕 thought.

►…に意を用いる　take care of…; be careful ┏of [about]…; be mindful of…; pay attention to…; give one's mind to…
・遺憾[満足]の意を表する　express one's ┏regret [satisfaction]
・意を決する　make up one's mind
・彼女は意を決して証言台に立った.　She ┏gathered her resolve [screwed up her courage] and ┏took [got up on] the witness stand.

・意を注ぐ　focus [fix] attention on…
・会社側はこの計画の実現にもっと意を注ぐべきだ.　The company side should give more attention to putting the plan into effect.
・その知らせを聞いて彼女はようやく意を安んじた.　When she heard the news she at last felt ┏at ease [reassured].
・それでわれわれは大いに意を強くした.　We were very reassured by that.
・彼女の今の発言で私は意を強くした.　What she just said ┏gives me confidence [encourages me, is reassuring to me].
►彼は失敗も意とせず最後までやり抜いた.　He didn't let failure ┏bother [faze] him, and kept on through to the end.
・彼の作品は意余って言葉足らずだ.　He tried to say more in his writings than he was able to.
2 〔考え〕 a thought; an idea; 〔意向〕 a mind; an inclination; a will; an intention; a thought; an idea.
►当局にその法令を改正する意があることを大臣はほのめかした.　The minister ┏hinted [suggested, intimated] that the proper authorities ┏had it in mind to revise [intended to revise, were thinking of revising] those rules and regulations.
►人の意に従う　do as sb dictates; be subject to sb's will; yield to [comply with] sb's wishes
・人を自分の意に従わせる　give the law to sb; lay down the law to sb
・人の意に背く[逆らう]　act ┏against [contrary to] sb's will
・その結果は私の意に反するものだった.　The results ┏were [went] contrary to what I expected.
►人の意を受けて　(acting) ┏in compliance with [in conformity to] sb's ┏wishes [instructions]
・人の意を体して　(acting) in accord with sb's wishes
・人の意を叶える　grant sb's wish
・人の意を探る　sound sb's mind; feel sb out
・人の意を解する　understand sb's ┏mind [idea]; read sb's mind
・(人に)意を通じる　(secretly [discretely]) make one's intention known 《to…》; make oneself understood; let sb know one's intention (in confidence)
・意を明らかにする　disclose [clarify] one's intention.
3 〔言葉や行為の内容〕 a meaning; sense; (大意) general meaning; gist. [＝いみ２].
►彼の釈明は意を得ないものだった.　What he said in his own defense was not convincing.
►読書百遍意おのずから通ず.　⇒どくしょ.
意到りて筆随(したが)う.　The pen keeps up as the (poet's) mind races ahead. ｜ The brush (of the master poet) moves as one with ┏his [her] thought.
意に介する　mind; take sth to one's heart; give heed to…; worry (oneself) about….
►意に介さない　do not mind; do not care (about [for])…; do not take sth to heart; be indifferent 《to…》
・危険を意に介さない　be reckless in the face of danger
・私は人が何と言おうと意に介さない.　I don't care what others may say about me.
・…を意に介さずに　regardless [reckless] of…
・彼は父親の言うことなど意に介する様子もなかった.　He didn't seem to take what his father said seriously.
意に適(かな)う
►この提案は社長の意に適うだろう.　The president will probably like this proposal.
・自分の意に適った方法を選びなさい.　Choose a method that ┏suits you [you like].
意に染まない　not be taken with sth; not be in the mood for sth; be uninterested in doing.
►彼女は意に染まない結婚をした.　She married someone she didn't particularly like.
意を致す　〔意志を伝える〕 convey [get across] one's intention; make oneself understood; 〔十分に配慮する〕 take into full consideration; be fully considerate of….
意を酌む　〔気持ちを〕 gather [intuit, sense] what sb feels; 〔意向を〕 gather [intuit] what sb wishes.
►先方の意を酌んで取引の継続を決めた.　Gathering that this is what the other party wished, we decided to continue doing business with them.
意を尽くす　fully express what one wants to say.
►この手紙では彼女の意は尽くされていないと思う.　I don't think this letter says everything she wants to say.
・その患者は医師の意を尽くした説明に納得した.　That patient was convinced by the doctor's exhaustive explanation.
意を迎える　go along with 《sb's wishes》; accommodate 《sb》; be agreeable.
►これは大国の意を迎える外交政策だ.　That is diplomacy that ┏curries favor with [plays up to] larger countries.
わが意を得たり
►この記事には「わが意を得たり」と思ったよ.　〔自分が感じているとおりだ〕 Reading this article, I felt "That's exactly how I feel!" ｜ 〔自分の考えに一致している〕 Reading this article, I ┏felt [thought to myself] "That's exactly what I think, too!" ["Them's my sentiments to a T!", "Somebody's been reading my mind!"]
